data.name: Capital Guaranteed Pension Account
data.description:
Capital Guaranteed Pension account is a complying account
based pension.
Account based pensions are designed to convert your
accumulated superannuation into a tax effective income
stream. This income is paid into your nominated bank account.
The minimum amount you draw from your pension account each
year is subject to a pension factor set by the Government and
other Government prescribed pension standards.

eligibility.additionalInfo: Under the laws applying to superannuation and RSA’s, your accumulated benefits cannot be paid to you until you satisfy a condition of release. This is known as ‘Preservation rules’. As super enjoys tax advantages, the law restricts when you are able to access this money. These restrictions are known as ‘Preservation rules’. The objectives of these rules are to ensure that your funds are used for their intended purpose which is to provide financial security in retirement. Until such time that a condition of release is met, your preserved and restricted non-preserved benefit must remain within the superannuation system. In summary, your Capital Guaranteed Super account is subject to preservation rules and are only payable in certain situations.  Please refer to the PDS available at: https://www.australianmilitarybank.com.au/sites/default/files/AusMilBank_RSA%20Pension%20PDS_020919.pdf

Once you have commenced a Capital Guaranteed Pension account, you cannot make any additional contributions to your account. You must invest any other contribution in a separate super accumulation account. For this reason, contributions are often consolidated before opening a pension account.

You can commence a Capital Guaranteed Pension if you have immediate access to your superannuation funds. This means you have met one of the conditions of release (refer to our PDS - https://www.australianmilitarybank.com.au/sites/default/files/AusMilBank_RSA%20Pension%20PDS_020919.pdf)

fees.name: Early Termination Fee (Fixed deposit option)
fees.additionalInfo: This charge is not a fixed amount but a reduction in the interest rate to the lowest rate for the period invested.

fees.name: Administration Fee
fees.additionalInfo: $5 per month, deducted from variable interest option per account

depositRates.additionalInfo: Minimum investment is $20,000. Interest is calculated daily and paid at maturity to members' accounts. Rates effective 20 October and are subject to change at Australian Military Bank’s discretion.
